1.text: Put arborio rice into a strainer and rinse it until the water runs clear.

2.text: Place the rinsed rice into your rice cooker and pour in 3 cups (710 ml) of water.

3.text: Close the lid and turn the rice cooker on.

4.text: Fluff the arborio rice and let it sit for 10 minutes before you serve it.

5.text: Simmer 3 cups (710 ml) of chicken broth over medium-low heat.

6.text: Sauté 1 onion over medium-low heat for 5 to 8 minutes.

7.text: Add the rice to the onion and cook it for 2 to 3 minutes.

8.text: Pour the wine in the pan and let it cook off for 1 minute.

9.text: Stir in the broth 1 ladleful at a time.

10.text: Continue to stir in the broth and cook the rice for 18 to 22 minutes.

11.text: Turn off the burner and stir in the butter, parmesan, salt, and pepper.

12.text: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (163 °C) and butter a baking dish.

13.text: Put the rice, sugar, salt, and optional vanilla bean into the dish.

14.text: Pour in 4 cups (950 ml) of whole milk and scatter the butter over the top.

15.text: Bake the pudding for 1 hour and 45 minutes and stir it frequently.

16.text: Remove the pudding and let it sit for 10 to 15 minutes.

17.text: Serve the arborio rice pudding with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
